revised_title: Water Metabolism and Thermoregulation in Dik-Dik Antelopes
tldr: This study investigates the water metabolism and thermoregulation of the dik-dik antelope, a small East African antelope that can survive without drinking. The research focuses on how these antelopes lose water mainly by panting and how they conserve water in hot and arid environments. The findings show that the dik-dik's efficient kidneys and low-water exchange help them inhabit hot arid areas. The respiratory tract plays a major role in dissipating excess heat in these antelopes.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Ecology and Environmental Science
